stanza.line: To me fair friend you never can be oldold
For as you were when first your eye I eyedeyed
Such seems your beauty still three winters coldcold
Have from the forests shook three summers pridepride
Three beauteous springs to yellow autumn turnedturned
In process of the seasons have I seenseen
Three April perfumes in three hot Junes burnedburned
Since first I saw you fresh which yet are greengreen
Ah yet doth beauty like a dial handhand
Steal from his figure and no pace perceivedperceived
So your sweet hue which methinks still doth standstand
Hath motion and mine eye may be deceiveddeceived
For fear of which hear this thou age unbredunbred
Ere you were born was beauty summer deaddead
